data.name: '032a1d51-428a-4b16-bf75-ebff5e1755d2'_Title
data.value: Inefficient String Concatenation

data.name: '032a1d51-428a-4b16-bf75-ebff5e1755d2'_Description
data.value: Excessive string concatenation is causing lots of allocations and CPU consumption.

data.name: '032a1d51-428a-4b16-bf75-ebff5e1755d2'_DocURL
data.value: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2017/profiling/da0001-use-stringbuilder-for-concatenations

data.name: '032a1d51-428a-4b16-bf75-ebff5e1755d2'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using StringBuilder to reduce concatenation operations.

data.name: '3fa80749-01a7-44ef-b90e-712c67b417b4'_Title
data.value: ThreadPool starvation events detected

data.name: '3fa80749-01a7-44ef-b90e-712c67b417b4'_Description
data.value: ThreadPool starvation occurs when the pool has no available threads to process new work items and it often causes applications to respond slowly.

data.name: '3fa80749-01a7-44ef-b90e-712c67b417b4'_DocURL
data.value: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/diagnostics/debug-threadpool-starvation

data.name: '3fa80749-01a7-44ef-b90e-712c67b417b4'_Recommendation
data.value: Follow the documentation to locate and fix the thread pool starvation issue.

data.name: '3fa80749-01a7-44ef-b90e-712c67b417b4'_Rationale
data.value: {value} thread pool starvation events happened. We expect this number to be {relation} than {criteria}.

data.name: 'daddcbb2-da8f-4b73-936b-7865c17699a5'_Title
data.value: Excessive CPU time in OutputDebugStringW

data.name: 'daddcbb2-da8f-4b73-936b-7865c17699a5'_Description
data.value: Excessive CPU time is spent in OutputDebugStringW.

data.name: 'daddcbb2-da8f-4b73-936b-7865c17699a5'_Recommendation
data.value: Any CPU time spent in this API is likely a bug, as this API is only meant for use during debugging. One way this shows up is via TraceInternal.Write* or TraceSource if System.Diagnostics.DefaultTraceListener is enabled.

data.name: 'f7151ced-f073-4d65-833a-ac8c01b6754f'_Title
data.value: Inefficient Trace.WriteLine usage

data.name: 'f7151ced-f073-4d65-833a-ac8c01b6754f'_Description
data.value: Excessive CPU time is spent in TraceInternal.WriteLine.

data.name: 'f7151ced-f073-4d65-833a-ac8c01b6754f'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider reducing the amount of logging done in this app, or look at replacing this type of logging with a high-performance logger such as EventSource.

data.name: 'a9e711cb-ca1d-4378-b689-92d1b03bc437'_Title
data.value: Incorrect Equality Comparison Implementation

data.name: 'a9e711cb-ca1d-4378-b689-92d1b03bc437'_Description
data.value: Reflection is being used by Compare/Equality functions. This could be because of a missing `Equals` override or incorrect `IEquatable<T>`/`IEqualityComparer<T>` implementation.

data.name: 'a9e711cb-ca1d-4378-b689-92d1b03bc437'_Recommendation
data.value: This can be fixed by providing the missing `Equals` override or properly implementing the `IEquatable<T>`/`IEqualityComparer<T>` interface.

data.name: 'a9e711cb-ca1d-4378-b689-92d1b03bc437'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '68ff5cc5-beaf-4c2e-b8f2-433c48af1708'_Title
data.value: Allocations in `Equals`/`GetHashCode`

data.name: '68ff5cc5-beaf-4c2e-b8f2-433c48af1708'_Description
data.value: Hot-path methods like `Equals`/`GetHashCode` should be kept allocation free. LINQ methods tend to allocate enumerators on the Heap, while `string.Format` leads to string allocations.

data.name: '68ff5cc5-beaf-4c2e-b8f2-433c48af1708'_Recommendation
data.value: This can be fixed by removing calls to such methods. LINQ queries can be unrolled into loops. `string.Format` can be replaced with a comparison of it's component strings.

data.name: '68ff5cc5-beaf-4c2e-b8f2-433c48af1708'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '9346bb84-de05-44ca-b2ff-874eda19340e'_Title
data.value: Excessive Allocations Due to List/Dictionary Resizing

data.name: '9346bb84-de05-44ca-b2ff-874eda19340e'_Description
data.value: Too many allocations are being caused by resizing due to calls associated with List/Dictionary resizing.

data.name: '9346bb84-de05-44ca-b2ff-874eda19340e'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider initializing the List/Dictionary with an explicit size if available or can be computed.

data.name: '9346bb84-de05-44ca-b2ff-874eda19340e'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '9095c47b-63d2-447a-ac64-7d6740226546'_Title
data.value: Excessive Allocations of Dictionaries/Lists/StringBuilder/HashSet Types

data.name: '9095c47b-63d2-447a-ac64-7d6740226546'_Description
data.value: Too much CPU is spent in allocations of types like List, StringBuilder, Dictionary, HashSet etc., which can be reused.

data.name: '9095c47b-63d2-447a-ac64-7d6740226546'_Recommendation
data.value: This can be fixed by reusing instances of these types instead of allocating a new one every time.

data.name: '9095c47b-63d2-447a-ac64-7d6740226546'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '3095f90e-3f92-4868-a30e-d645a4be2395'_Title
data.value: Inefficient String Concatenation

data.name: '3095f90e-3f92-4868-a30e-d645a4be2395'_Description
data.value: Excessive string concatenation is causing lots of allocations and CPU consumption.

data.name: '3095f90e-3f92-4868-a30e-d645a4be2395'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using cheaper alternatives such as `String.Join` or a `StringBuilder` instead.

data.name: '3095f90e-3f92-4868-a30e-d645a4be2395'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '4a8a2a45-6f67-474e-b307-79d8b507d466'_Title
data.value: Heap Allocations Due to Tuples

data.name: '4a8a2a45-6f67-474e-b307-79d8b507d466'_Description
data.value: Tuples in C# are classes so they need to be allocated on the Heap. As a result, `Dictionary<K, V>.FindEntry()` seems to be causing allocations.

data.name: '4a8a2a45-6f67-474e-b307-79d8b507d466'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider replacing `Tuple` with `ValueTuple`, which are structs and are no allocated on the Heap.

data.name: '4a8a2a45-6f67-474e-b307-79d8b507d466'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'd77d16b3-5af1-4b51-8d99-bc75c0b088a8'_Title
data.value: High CPU Costs Due to Expensive Methods

data.name: 'd77d16b3-5af1-4b51-8d99-bc75c0b088a8'_Description
data.value: Expensive methods such as `ConcurrentDictionary<T1, T2>.GetKeys()`, `Process.ProcessName`, `DateTime.Now`, `System.Type.GetType()`, `GetCustomAttributes()`, etc. are consuming a lot of CPU.

data.name: 'd77d16b3-5af1-4b51-8d99-bc75c0b088a8'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider caching the results of these methods.

data.name: 'd77d16b3-5af1-4b51-8d99-bc75c0b088a8'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '63a56899-bfd2-4cf5-aae4-a781df3799e8'_Title
data.value: `CopyTo` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '63a56899-bfd2-4cf5-aae4-a781df3799e8'_Description
data.value: `CopyTo` is taking a lot of CPU. This may be because of the buffer size being too small.

data.name: '63a56899-bfd2-4cf5-aae4-a781df3799e8'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider increasing the buffer size supplied to the `CopyTo` method.

data.name: '63a56899-bfd2-4cf5-aae4-a781df3799e8'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'f7d870e1-c929-49fa-a59f-bf8e034edeb1'_Title
data.value: `Activator.CreateInstance` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: 'f7d870e1-c929-49fa-a59f-bf8e034edeb1'_Description
data.value: `Activator.CreateInstance` takes up a lot of CPU because it is implemented using Reflection.

data.name: 'f7d870e1-c929-49fa-a59f-bf8e034edeb1'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using alternatives such as passing in an allocation delegate, compiled lambdas or emitting IL.

data.name: 'f7d870e1-c929-49fa-a59f-bf8e034edeb1'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '82a95bad-3d44-4d94-8075-449394c1859d'_Title
data.value: `Regex.IsMatch` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '82a95bad-3d44-4d94-8075-449394c1859d'_Description
data.value: `Regex.IsMatch` is taking up a lot of CPU.

data.name: '82a95bad-3d44-4d94-8075-449394c1859d'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using a compiled regex using `RegexOptions.Compiled` or compiling to assembly using `RegexOptions.CompileToAssembly`.

data.name: '82a95bad-3d44-4d94-8075-449394c1859d'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '3252749a-c8cf-4055-9a66-c0ba16f7703c'_Title
data.value: Excessive Allocations Due to `System.Stream.ReadByte()`/`System.Stream.WriteByte()`

data.name: '3252749a-c8cf-4055-9a66-c0ba16f7703c'_Description
data.value: When deriving from `System.Stream`, the default implementations of `ReadByte`/`WriteByte` would be used unless overridden. These methods allocate a single byte array upon each run, which can lead to a lot of Heap allocations.

data.name: '3252749a-c8cf-4055-9a66-c0ba16f7703c'_Recommendation
data.value: Make sure you are not missing overrides of `ReadByte`/`WriteByte` when deriving `System.Stream` and using a cached buffer.

data.name: '3252749a-c8cf-4055-9a66-c0ba16f7703c'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '3c56330d-ca86-4ea6-a7a4-c97c9e08418d'_Title
data.value: `IEnumerable<T>.Count()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '3c56330d-ca86-4ea6-a7a4-c97c9e08418d'_Description
data.value: Calling `IEnumerable<T>.Count()`, causes the entire enumerable to be enumerated. This can lead to multiple enumeration if `IEnumerable<T>.Count()` is called on the same enumerable from multiple locations.

data.name: '3c56330d-ca86-4ea6-a7a4-c97c9e08418d'_Recommendation
data.value: Make sure the same enumerable is not being enumerated on multiple times. If more than one calls are found and the enumerable doesn't change between successive calls to `Count()`, consider caching and re-using the results. Other options are to use `List<T>` to get access to `Count` property, or check if the enumerable is an `ICollection<T>` underneath to avoid having to call `ToList()`. Use `IEnumerable<T>.Any()` if count is only used to check whether the enumerable is non-empty.

data.name: '3c56330d-ca86-4ea6-a7a4-c97c9e08418d'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'a41d3cf0-29c2-41bc-a01a-6e38d77db0ad'_Title
data.value: `IEnumerable<T>.ElementAt()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: 'a41d3cf0-29c2-41bc-a01a-6e38d77db0ad'_Description
data.value: `ElementAt` iterates over the entire enumerable to find the element at a specific index.

data.name: 'a41d3cf0-29c2-41bc-a01a-6e38d77db0ad'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using `List<T>` as it has constant access to elements by index.

data.name: 'a41d3cf0-29c2-41bc-a01a-6e38d77db0ad'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '991d40cb-6bf7-46ba-97d4-3b460273a659'_Title
data.value: `List<T>.Contains()` Taking Up Too Much CPU

data.name: '991d40cb-6bf7-46ba-97d4-3b460273a659'_Description
data.value: `List<T>.Contains()` needs to iterate over the `List` to check if an element exists, which tends to be O(N) in the worst case.

data.name: '991d40cb-6bf7-46ba-97d4-3b460273a659'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using a `HashSet<T>` instead of a `List<T>` or maintaining one in addition to the `List`.

data.name: '991d40cb-6bf7-46ba-97d4-3b460273a659'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '9e7e6b7d-c3a7-4b07-81ef-ed305b58d22f'_Title
data.value: `ContainsKey` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '9e7e6b7d-c3a7-4b07-81ef-ed305b58d22f'_Description
data.value: Using `Dictionary<K, V>.ContainsKey()` along with a `Dictionary` lookup can lead to double dictionary lookup anti-pattern.

data.name: '9e7e6b7d-c3a7-4b07-81ef-ed305b58d22f'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider replacing `Dictionary<K, V>.ContainsKey()` and lookup with `Dictionary<K, V>.TryGetValue()`, which is more optimal as it avoids the double cost of checking if a key exists in the `Dictionary` and then accessing the corresponding value, and instead gets both results in a single call.

data.name: '9e7e6b7d-c3a7-4b07-81ef-ed305b58d22f'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '210fc8b5-d654-4813-b44f-296c4f6a2df7'_Title
data.value: `ConcurrentDictionary<K, V>.Count` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '210fc8b5-d654-4813-b44f-296c4f6a2df7'_Description
data.value: `ConcurrentDictionary<K, V>.Count` takes a lock and calling it too frequently can cause CPU bottlenecks.

data.name: '210fc8b5-d654-4813-b44f-296c4f6a2df7'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider keeping a cached local count and updating it using `Interlocked.Increment`/`Decrement`.

data.name: '210fc8b5-d654-4813-b44f-296c4f6a2df7'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '2e20ddea-ae18-465c-b74e-3df385578ad6'_Title
data.value: `IEnumerable<T>.OrderBy().FirstOrDefault()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '2e20ddea-ae18-465c-b74e-3df385578ad6'_Description
data.value: LINQ query `IEnumerable<T>.OrderBy().FirstOrDefault()` sorts the entire enumerable only to get the smallest/largest element, which can be very slow because of having O(N*log(N)) complexity.

data.name: '2e20ddea-ae18-465c-b74e-3df385578ad6'_Recommendation
data.value: This can be done in O(N) by simply iterating over the enumerable and getting the smallest/largest element or using `MinBy`/`MaxBy` on the `IEnumerable<T>`.

data.name: '2e20ddea-ae18-465c-b74e-3df385578ad6'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '23a5db7d-682e-42f7-928d-abb061a755cc'_Title
data.value: `Array.Reverse()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory Due to Boxing

data.name: '23a5db7d-682e-42f7-928d-abb061a755cc'_Description
data.value: `Array.Reverse` is a non-generic method and is implemented using boxing.

data.name: '23a5db7d-682e-42f7-928d-abb061a755cc'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider implementing your own reverse function.

data.name: '23a5db7d-682e-42f7-928d-abb061a755cc'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '3f51a46a-39c3-462e-ab77-f3f15ca60f1f'_Title
data.value: Lock Contention in `TraceSource.TraceData()`

data.name: '3f51a46a-39c3-462e-ab77-f3f15ca60f1f'_Description
data.value: `TraceSource.TraceData()` is taking up a lot of CPU due to lock contention.

data.name: '3f51a46a-39c3-462e-ab77-f3f15ca60f1f'_Recommendation
data.value: Avoid using `TraceSource.TraceData()`, or make sure all listeners are thread-safe to turn off locking.

data.name: '3f51a46a-39c3-462e-ab77-f3f15ca60f1f'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'd19b35dd-29e6-4a1a-9576-864123829a05'_Title
data.value: Unnecessary String Allocations and CPU Usage Due to `String.Split()`

data.name: 'd19b35dd-29e6-4a1a-9576-864123829a05'_Description
data.value: `String.Split()` can lead to unnecessary string allocations and CPU usage.

data.name: 'd19b35dd-29e6-4a1a-9576-864123829a05'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using cheaper alternatives.

data.name: 'd19b35dd-29e6-4a1a-9576-864123829a05'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '7538665d-770d-40fb-851e-2c133f8ef4ed'_Title
data.value: Expensive `IEnumerable<T>.ToList()` in Getter

data.name: '7538665d-770d-40fb-851e-2c133f8ef4ed'_Description
data.value: An expensive call to `IEnumerable<T>.ToList()` is being made from a getter.

data.name: '7538665d-770d-40fb-851e-2c133f8ef4ed'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider memoizing the results of `ToList` to make the getter as cheap as possible.

data.name: '7538665d-770d-40fb-851e-2c133f8ef4ed'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '2efbfd50-159a-42f7-88b9-4e5ad37de914'_Title
data.value: `IEnumerable<T>.ToList()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '2efbfd50-159a-42f7-88b9-4e5ad37de914'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU or Memory is being spent in `IEnumerable<T>.ToList()`.

data.name: '2efbfd50-159a-42f7-88b9-4e5ad37de914'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using `List<T>` from the start to avoid expensive calls to ToList(). Also, verify that `IEnumerable<T>.ToList()` isn't being called for a single enumeration, which can be accomplished simply by enumerating over the `IEnumerable<T>`.

data.name: '2efbfd50-159a-42f7-88b9-4e5ad37de914'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '889dd9ee-4eb0-43d0-9817-e10991ab4665'_Title
data.value: Unnecessary Allocations and CPU Cost Due to Boxing

data.name: '889dd9ee-4eb0-43d0-9817-e10991ab4665'_Description
data.value: Boxing is used to store value types in the garbage-collected heap. Boxing is an implicit conversion of a value type to the type object or to any interface type implemented by this value type. Boxing a value type allocates an object instance on the heap and copies the value into the new object. Boxing and unboxing are computationally expensive processes. When a value type is boxed, a new object must be allocated and constructed. To a lesser degree, the cast required for unboxing is also expensive computationally.

data.name: '889dd9ee-4eb0-43d0-9817-e10991ab4665'_Recommendation
data.value: It is best to avoid using value types in situations where they must be boxed a high number of times, for example in non-generic collections classes such as `Collections.ArrayList`. You can avoid boxing of value types by using generic collections such as `List<T>`.

data.name: '889dd9ee-4eb0-43d0-9817-e10991ab4665'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'dfebc4ff-775b-406e-a365-5e225d6a52ee'_Title
data.value: Too Much Exception Handling

data.name: 'dfebc4ff-775b-406e-a365-5e225d6a52ee'_Description
data.value: CPU Bottlenecks are showing up due to excessive exception handling.

data.name: 'dfebc4ff-775b-406e-a365-5e225d6a52ee'_Recommendation
data.value: Investigate why so many exceptions are being thrown, as this may be due to an underlying bug.

data.name: 'dfebc4ff-775b-406e-a365-5e225d6a52ee'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'cfe41042-b355-46b6-8933-32e6d378dd00'_Title
data.value: Garbage Collection Showing Up in CPU Trace

data.name: 'cfe41042-b355-46b6-8933-32e6d378dd00'_Description
data.value: Induced Garbage Collection (GC) is showing up as a bottleneck in CPU trace.

data.name: 'cfe41042-b355-46b6-8933-32e6d378dd00'_Recommendation
data.value: Look at the allocation data and your code to make sure there are no unnecessary allocations.

data.name: 'cfe41042-b355-46b6-8933-32e6d378dd00'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'cf44c716-6455-4dc0-9fa4-343a212444e1'_Title
data.value: `X509Certificate.X509Chain.Build` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: 'cf44c716-6455-4dc0-9fa4-343a212444e1'_Description
data.value: `X509Chain.Build` is called on each request, instead of being cached.

data.name: 'cf44c716-6455-4dc0-9fa4-343a212444e1'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using a newer version of .NET (>5), which caches the chain result so that it is not built on each request. Also, if you are using containers, consider switching to Windows containers as they have faster X509 chain building.

data.name: 'cf44c716-6455-4dc0-9fa4-343a212444e1'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '4810b7ad-dcb2-483a-b6af-6bf7562b1fe6'_Title
data.value: Lock Contention Appearing in CPU Trace

data.name: '4810b7ad-dcb2-483a-b6af-6bf7562b1fe6'_Description
data.value: Lock contention occurs when a thread waits for a lock while another thread possesses that lock. Contentious locks can be bad for your application's throughput and lead to scalability issues.

data.name: '4810b7ad-dcb2-483a-b6af-6bf7562b1fe6'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider options like reducing lock granularity, using a lock-free library or re-writing the code such that it doesn't require a lock.

data.name: '4810b7ad-dcb2-483a-b6af-6bf7562b1fe6'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'cfa35fd6-1c4a-411a-9e56-d4b6989e1b73'_Title
data.value: Active Directory Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: 'cfa35fd6-1c4a-411a-9e56-d4b6989e1b73'_Description
data.value: Active Directory is causing CPU bottlenecks and allocations.

data.name: 'cfa35fd6-1c4a-411a-9e56-d4b6989e1b73'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider switching from Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) to Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL).

data.name: 'cfa35fd6-1c4a-411a-9e56-d4b6989e1b73'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'bb77a27d-7115-415d-9205-d1efde790f78'_Title
data.value: String.ToLower() Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: 'bb77a27d-7115-415d-9205-d1efde790f78'_Description
data.value: ToLower is taking a lot of CPU/Memory. This may be because of repeat calls to ToLower on the same set of strings.

data.name: 'bb77a27d-7115-415d-9205-d1efde790f78'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using CaseInsensitive comparisons or caching the results of ToLower.

data.name: 'bb77a27d-7115-415d-9205-d1efde790f78'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'cdf08e8f-36e5-4024-9110-7b887ba6f112'_Title
data.value: Inefficient `String.SubString()`

data.name: 'cdf08e8f-36e5-4024-9110-7b887ba6f112'_Description
data.value: Excessive `String.SubString()` is causing lots of allocations and CPU consumption.

data.name: 'cdf08e8f-36e5-4024-9110-7b887ba6f112'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider using cheaper alternatives such as `String.AsSpan()`.

data.name: 'cdf08e8f-36e5-4024-9110-7b887ba6f112'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '86763918-4391-47e7-ab4d-e83b1b06066a'_Title
data.value: Calls To Static Regex Functions Causing Contention

data.name: '86763918-4391-47e7-ab4d-e83b1b06066a'_Description
data.value: Static Regex calls are causing contention in the Regex cache.

data.name: '86763918-4391-47e7-ab4d-e83b1b06066a'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider creating an instance of the `Regex` and call the member method `IsMatch`\`Match`\`Split` instead of calling the static variants.

data.name: '86763918-4391-47e7-ab4d-e83b1b06066a'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '7c07a45a-9234-419d-95d1-6b3b77d38219'_Title
data.value: Excessive Calls to `Enum.ToString()`

data.name: '7c07a45a-9234-419d-95d1-6b3b77d38219'_Description
data.value: Excessive `Enum.ToString()` causing lots of allocations.

data.name: '7c07a45a-9234-419d-95d1-6b3b77d38219'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider caching `Enum.ToString()` results in a dictionary.

data.name: '7c07a45a-9234-419d-95d1-6b3b77d38219'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'c96149cd-8d3c-4f09-9854-76ed3f5405ae'_Title
data.value: High CPU/Memory Costs Due to Logging

data.name: 'c96149cd-8d3c-4f09-9854-76ed3f5405ae'_Description
data.value: Too much CPU/Memory is being spent in logging.

data.name: 'c96149cd-8d3c-4f09-9854-76ed3f5405ae'_Recommendation
data.value: Check logging levels and reduce the volume of logs in production. Consider tweaking level for each category. Also consider high performance logging (Reference: https://aka.ms/AAfkq94).

data.name: 'c96149cd-8d3c-4f09-9854-76ed3f5405ae'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '51eb34e8-6c6b-4442-952f-c53e4a97f67f'_Title
data.value: Too Much CPU/Memory Taken by LINQ Query Chaining `IEnumerable<T>.Where()` and `IEnumerable<T>.Count()`

data.name: '51eb34e8-6c6b-4442-952f-c53e4a97f67f'_Description
data.value: Nested `Where` calls would lead to multiple passes over the enumerable leading to unnecessary CPU usage as well as iterator allocations.

data.name: '51eb34e8-6c6b-4442-952f-c53e4a97f67f'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider condensing the chain of `IEnumerable<T>.Where(<lambda function>).Count()` to simply a `IEnumerable<T>.Count(<lambda function>)`.

data.name: '51eb34e8-6c6b-4442-952f-c53e4a97f67f'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '867032d6-7d2d-4edd-9f6c-fa132ca45fdd'_Title
data.value: Excessive Allocations of `KeyVaultClient` Type

data.name: '867032d6-7d2d-4edd-9f6c-fa132ca45fdd'_Description
data.value: Too many allocations of type `KeyVaultClient`, which need not be re-allocated if an instance pointing to the same Key Vault already exists.

data.name: '867032d6-7d2d-4edd-9f6c-fa132ca45fdd'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider reusing `KeyVaultClient` instances.

data.name: '867032d6-7d2d-4edd-9f6c-fa132ca45fdd'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '93f5643f-7bb6-45f0-947e-73f48e27c8da'_Title
data.value: `IEnumerable<T>.Any()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '93f5643f-7bb6-45f0-947e-73f48e27c8da'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU or Memory is being consumed by `IEnumerable<T>.Any()` calls.

data.name: '93f5643f-7bb6-45f0-947e-73f48e27c8da'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider unrolling the LINQ expression to use an explicit for-loop. In case of nested LINQ expressions, make sure that same computations are not being repeated unnecessarily. If possible, hoist them to the outermost loop where they can be computed.

data.name: '93f5643f-7bb6-45f0-947e-73f48e27c8da'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '233a5e73-1b97-4b8f-bdce-7ff32a19ae0a'_Title
data.value: `Dictionary<K, V>.FindEntry()` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '233a5e73-1b97-4b8f-bdce-7ff32a19ae0a'_Description
data.value: A lot of exclusive CPU time is being spent in `Dictionary<K, V>.FindEntry()` calls.

data.name: '233a5e73-1b97-4b8f-bdce-7ff32a19ae0a'_Recommendation
data.value: This often happens when a Dictionary gets corrupted due to unguarded concurrent writes. If this is occurring, consider using a ConcurrentDictionary instead or appropriate lock protection.

data.name: '233a5e73-1b97-4b8f-bdce-7ff32a19ae0a'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '9887cafc-662a-4535-8507-cbc350e8b63b'_Title
data.value: `Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.SerializeObject()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '9887cafc-662a-4535-8507-cbc350e8b63b'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU and memory are being spent on calls to `Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.SerializeObject()`.

data.name: '9887cafc-662a-4535-8507-cbc350e8b63b'_Recommendation
data.value:
Make sure you're not recreating a `ContractResolver` every time you use `JsonSerializer`. Instead, you should create the contract resolver once and reuse it. Please note that if you are not using an explicit contract resolver, then a shared internal instance is automatically used when serializing and deserializing.
If you have .NET 5 SDK or above, consider switching to `System.Text.Json` to use source generation, regardless of the .NET version you target. Source generation allows for the inspection of serializable types to be done at compile time instead of needing to use reflection at runtime and is, therefore, able to provide much better performance.
Please note that when using `System.Text.Json`, if you need to use `JsonSerializerOptions` repeatedly with the same options, consider reusing the same `JsonSerializerOptions` instance for each call to Serialize/Deserialize. Since the instance is thread-safe and immutable after the first serialization or deserialization, it's safe to use the same instance.

data.name: '9887cafc-662a-4535-8507-cbc350e8b63b'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'cbf057a5-f58e-4b9d-bdb1-a15941bde5bc'_Title
data.value: `Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.DeserializeObject()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: 'cbf057a5-f58e-4b9d-bdb1-a15941bde5bc'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU and memory are being spent on calls to `Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.DeserializeObject()`.

data.name: 'cbf057a5-f58e-4b9d-bdb1-a15941bde5bc'_Recommendation
data.value:
Make sure you're not recreating a `ContractResolver` every time you use `JsonSerializer`. Instead, you should create the contract resolver once and reuse it. Please note that if you are not using an explicit contract resolver, then a shared internal instance is automatically used when serializing and deserializing.
If you have .NET 5 SDK or above, consider switching to `System.Text.Json` to use source generation, regardless of the .NET version you target. Source generation allows for the inspection of serializable types to be done at compile time instead of needing to use reflection at runtime and is, therefore, able to provide much better performance.
Please note that when using `System.Text.Json`, if you need to use `JsonSerializerOptions` repeatedly with the same options, consider reusing the same `JsonSerializerOptions` instance for each call to Serialize/Deserialize. Since the instance is thread-safe and immutable after the first serialization or deserialization, it's safe to use the same instance.

data.name: 'cbf057a5-f58e-4b9d-bdb1-a15941bde5bc'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '4b8e9c5d-34b7-480b-8393-4cb74a0afcf7'_Title
data.value: `IEnumerable<T>.Single()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '4b8e9c5d-34b7-480b-8393-4cb74a0afcf7'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU or Memory is being consumed by `IEnumerable<T>.Single()` calls.

data.name: '4b8e9c5d-34b7-480b-8393-4cb74a0afcf7'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider unrolling the LINQ expression to use an explicit for-loop. In case of nested LINQ expressions, make sure that same computations are not being repeated unnecessarily. If possible, hoist them to the outermost loop where they can be computed.

data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'e892ab76-8c7a-4203-af18-a7823b31386a'_Title
data.value: `Enumerable<T>.ToArray()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: 'e892ab76-8c7a-4203-af18-a7823b31386a'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU or Memory is being spent in `Enumerable<T>.ToArray()`.

data.name: 'e892ab76-8c7a-4203-af18-a7823b31386a'_Recommendation
data.value: Verify that `Enumerable<T>.ToArray()` isn't being called for a single enumeration, which can be accomplished simply by enumerating over the `Enumerable<T>`.

data.value: `Enumerable<T>.ToDictionary()` Taking Too Much CPU/Memory

data.name: '1353f344-ea43-44f3-99cf-6ac7e7f7237a'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU or Memory is being spent in `Enumerable<T>.ToDictionary()`.

data.name: '1353f344-ea43-44f3-99cf-6ac7e7f7237a'_Recommendation
data.value: Verify that `Enumerable<T>.ToDictionary()` isn't being called for a few look-ups in the resulting `Dictionary<K, V>`. This can instead be accomplished simply by enumerating over the `Enumerable<T>`.

data.name: 'b9f34b5c-3c92-43ab-aa57-e02c2bcf9ee6'_Title

data.value: A lot of CPU or Memory is being spent in `Queryable<T>.FirstOrDefault()`.

data.name: '0be5bb8f-d2a1-403d-94e7-3b0fa4e62ad6'_Title
data.value: `StreamReader.ReadToEnd()` Taking Too Much Memory

data.name: '0be5bb8f-d2a1-403d-94e7-3b0fa4e62ad6'_Description
data.value: A lot of Memory is being consumed by `StreamReader.ReadToEnd()`.

data.name: '0be5bb8f-d2a1-403d-94e7-3b0fa4e62ad6'_Recommendation
data.value: If the underlying stream is expected to be in JSON format, consider using a JSON parser directly over the stream rather than reading to a string and then parsing the resulting string.

data.name: '0be5bb8f-d2a1-403d-94e7-3b0fa4e62ad6'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '1eabc3f5-c470-4829-902f-0be5f8a38b66'_Title
data.value: `CompareInfo.IsPrefix()` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '1eabc3f5-c470-4829-902f-0be5f8a38b66'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU is being spent doing culture specific comparisons within calls to `CompareInfo.IsPrefix()`.

data.name: '1eabc3f5-c470-4829-902f-0be5f8a38b66'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider specifying a `StringComparison.Ordinal` comparison with `String.StartsWith`/`String.EndsWith` to avoid doing culture specific string comparisons, which tend to be more expensive.

data.name: '1eabc3f5-c470-4829-902f-0be5f8a38b66'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '220f26e5-3670-439f-a197-63897251b4b6'_Title
data.value: `String.IndexOf()` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '220f26e5-3670-439f-a197-63897251b4b6'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU is being spent doing culture specific comparisons within calls to `String.IndexOf()`.

data.name: '220f26e5-3670-439f-a197-63897251b4b6'_Recommendation
data.value: Consider specifying a `StringComparison.Ordinal` comparison with `String.IndexOf` to avoid doing culture specific string comparisons, which tend to be more expensive.

data.name: '220f26e5-3670-439f-a197-63897251b4b6'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: 'ef41de0e-0b00-45ff-8f9a-1c7530c06d91'_Title
data.value: `Dictionary<K, V>.Insert()` Taking Too Much CPU Due To `ObjectEqualityComparer`

data.name: 'ef41de0e-0b00-45ff-8f9a-1c7530c06d91'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU is being spent on calls to `Dictionary<K, V>.Insert()`.

data.name: 'ef41de0e-0b00-45ff-8f9a-1c7530c06d91'_Recommendation
data.value: Avoid using the default object comparer. Consider writing a custom comparer for the Dictionary Key type and specifying it in the Dictionary's constructor. Alternatively, implement `IEquatable<TKey>` on the Key type. Either of these will lead to faster comparisons than the default object comparer.

data.name: 'ef41de0e-0b00-45ff-8f9a-1c7530c06d91'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.value: `Dictionary<K, V>.Insert()` Taking Too Much CPU

data.name: '70472c33-0a67-4a1a-a2d5-8284c449a3b7'_Description
data.value: A lot of CPU is being spent on calls to `Dictionary<K, V>.Insert()`.

data.name: '70472c33-0a67-4a1a-a2d5-8284c449a3b7'_Recommendation
data.value: Make sure Dictionary entries are actually being re-used in look-ups.

data.name: '70472c33-0a67-4a1a-a2d5-8284c449a3b7'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.

data.name: '5e8edd39-27f0-49be-b99c-572b9a4d536b'_Title
data.value: Excessive Allocations of `System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex`

data.name: '5e8edd39-27f0-49be-b99c-572b9a4d536b'_Description
data.value: A lot of memory is spent in allocations of type `System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex`.

data.name: '5e8edd39-27f0-49be-b99c-572b9a4d536b'_Recommendation
data.value: Avoid creating Regex instances more than once with the same regular expression. If the regular expression is the same each time, then cache a single Regex instance in a static field.

data.name: '5e8edd39-27f0-49be-b99c-572b9a4d536b'_Rationale
data.value: {value}% of your {issueCategory} was spent in `{function}` called from `{parentFunction}`. We expected this value to be {relation}{criteria}%.
